message.content: I just upgraded ESlint to 9, but I need to update my config to match can you help

content.text: I'll help you update your ESLint configuration to work with ESLint 9. Let me first examine your current ESLint setup to understand what needs to be updated.

file.content:
{
  "name": "drizzle-cube-nextjs-example",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Next.js 15 example with drizzle-cube",
  "type": "module",
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "next dev -p 6001",
    "build": "next build",
    "start": "next start -p 6001",
    "lint": "eslint .",
    "typecheck": "tsc --noEmit",
    "setup": "npm run docker:up && sleep 5 && npm run db:migrate && npm run db:seed",
    "docker:up": "docker-compose up -d",
    "docker:down": "docker-compose down",
    "docker:reset": "docker-compose down -v && docker-compose up -d",
    "db:migrate": "tsx scripts/migrate.ts",
    "db:seed": "tsx scripts/seed.ts",
    "db:generate": "drizzle-kit generate"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@neondatabase/serverless": "^1.0.1",
    "drizzle-cube": "^0.1.31",
    "drizzle-orm": "^0.44.4",
    "next": "^15.0.0",
    "postgres": "^3.4.0",
    "react": "^18.3.0",
    "react-dom": "^18.3.0",
    "react-grid-layout": "^1.4.0",
    "react-resizable": "^3.0.0",
    "recharts": "^3.1.2"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@eslint/eslintrc": "^3.3.1",
    "@tailwindcss/postcss": "^4.1.12",
    "@types/node": "^20.0.0",
    "@types/react": "^18.3.0",
    "@types/react-dom": "^18.3.0",
    "@types/react-grid-layout": "^1.3.0",
    "autoprefixer": "^10.4.0",
    "drizzle-kit": "^0.31.4",
    "eslint": "^9.34.0",
    "eslint-config-next": "^15.0.0",
    "postcss": "^8.4.0",
    "tailwindcss": "^4.1.12",
    "tsx": "^4.0.0",
    "typescript": "^5.6.0"
  },
  "optionalDependencies": {
    "@rollup/rollup-linux-x64-gnu": "^4.24.0",
    "lightningcss-linux-x64-gnu": "^1.30.0"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "analytics",
    "drizzle",
    "nextjs",
    "cube",
    "semantic-layer"
  ],
  "author": "Drizzle Cube",
  "license": "MIT"
}

content.text: I can see you have ESLint 9 installed and a simple `.eslintrc.json` file that extends Next.js config. ESLint 9 uses the new flat config format, so I need to convert your configuration. Let me create the new `eslint.config.js` file:

content.content: The user doesn't want to proceed with this tool use. The tool use was rejected (eg. if it was a file edit, the new_string was NOT written to the file). STOP what you are doing and wait for the user to tell you how to proceed.

toolUseResult: Error: The user doesn't want to proceed with this tool use. The tool use was rejected (eg. if it was a file edit, the new_string was NOT written to the file). STOP what you are doing and wait for the user to tell you how to proceed.

content.text: [Request interrupted by user for tool use]

message.content: I think there is a tool that converts for you

content.text: You're right! ESLint provides a migration tool to automatically convert from the old format to the new flat config format. Let me use that instead:

input.description: Convert ESLint config to flat config format

content.content:
Migrating .eslintrc.json

Wrote new config to ./eslint.config.mjs

You will need to install the following packages to use the new config:
- @eslint/js
- @eslint/eslintrc

You can install them using the following command:

npm install @eslint/js @eslint/eslintrc -D

toolUseResult.stdout:
Migrating .eslintrc.json

Wrote new config to ./eslint.config.mjs

You will need to install the following packages to use the new config:
- @eslint/js
- @eslint/eslintrc

You can install them using the following command:

npm install @eslint/js @eslint/eslintrc -D

content.text: Perfect! The migration tool created the new config. Now I need to install the required dependencies:

content.content:

newTodos.activeForm: Updating ESLint config to ESLint 9 flat config format

content.text:
Perfect! Your ESLint configuration has been successfully updated to work with ESLint 9. Here's what I did:

1. Used the `@eslint/migrate-config` tool to automatically convert your `.eslintrc.json` to the new flat config format (`eslint.config.mjs`)
2. Installed the required dependencies (`@eslint/js` and `@eslint/eslintrc`) 
3. Removed the old `.eslintrc.json` file
4. Added proper ignore patterns to exclude build directories like `.next/`

The linting now runs successfully with no errors. Your configuration maintains the same Next.js core web vitals rules but now uses ESLint 9's flat config format.
